translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Section with Ekavihāri
The Elder Ambapālī’s Birth Story
“Padumuttara, the Buddha,
the world’s chief, the one of great patience,
was walking for alms,
and I gave him the best of robes.
Taking the best fruit,
with a serene mind,🔽I gave it to the hero,
the one worthy of offerings, the Teacher.
Because of that deed, O one who treads with the best gait,
world’s chief, bull among men,
I attained the unshakable state,
having abandoned victory and defeat.
For a hundred thousand eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the best.
My defilements are burned up,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Ambapālī spoke these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ambaphaliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ambaphaliyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ambaphaliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  ambaphaliya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Elder Ambapālī’s Birth Story is the tenth.
The forty-fourth section on Ekavihāri is finished.
The summary:

original: Thero ekavihārī ca,🔽saṅkhiyo pāṭihīrako;🔽Thaviko ucchukhaṇḍī ca,🔽kaḷambaambāṭakado.
analyzed: theraḥ ekavihārī ca  saṅkhiyaḥ pāṭihīrakaḥ  thavikaḥ ucchukhaṇḍī ca  kaḷamba ambāṭaka do
translated: The Elder, the one who lived alone,🔽The one who counted, the one who performed miracles,🔽The one who was a thief, the one who was a sugar-maker,

analyzed: harīta kamba piṇḍī ca  ambadaḥ dasamaḥ yati
translated: The one who was a bamboo worker, the one who was a mango-worker.🔽The one who was a myrobalan-worker,🔽The one who was a mango-worker, the tenth ascetic;
Sixty-six verses
Have been counted by the wise ones.
